update.description:
I fixed some ABI builds in pull request #834, but ign-physics was still broken. I've made two changes to fix the build and one change to speed it up.

* 1st fix: use c++17 if USE_GCC8 is true. The physics jobs were failing with error logs complaining about c++17 types (see https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5c3dd97591a3f06ab127a2efb9a2ff1a)
* 2nd fix: retry abi checker script with `-quick` if it doesn't generate a report. It seems to run out of memory in the normal mode, but setting `-quick` causes it to "[disable check of some template instances](https://github.com/lvc/abi-compliance-checker/blob/master/abi-compliance-checker.pl#L708-L709)", which appears to be enough to fix the ign-physics build.
* speed thing up by not building the tests

it passed with r2d2: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=83)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/

but drogon seems to always get disconnected when running this job: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=82)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/

update.description:
I fixed some ABI builds in pull request #834, but ign-physics was still broken. I've made two changes to fix the build and one change to speed it up.

* 1st fix: use c++17 if USE_GCC8 is true. The physics jobs were failing with error logs complaining about c++17 types (see https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5c3dd97591a3f06ab127a2efb9a2ff1a)
* 2nd fix: retry abi checker script with `-quick` if it doesn't generate a report. It seems to run out of memory in the normal mode, but setting `-quick` causes it to "[disable check of some template instances](https://github.com/lvc/abi-compliance-checker/blob/master/abi-compliance-checker.pl#L708-L709)", which appears to be enough to fix the ign-physics build.
* speed thing up by not building the tests

content.raw:
another option is to change the logic to preemptively use `-quick` for ign-physics builds instead of using it as a fallback after a failure.

I think my favorite option is huge-memory
content.html:
another option is to change the logic to preemptively use -quick for ign-physics builds instead of using it as a fallback after a failure.

I think my favorite option is huge-memory

pull_request.title: Fix and speed up ign-physics ABI builds

pullrequest.title: Fix and speed up ign-physics ABI builds

content.raw:
yay! nice work! Not fully sure about what can happen with drogon but my main hypothesis is that memory consumption reach top and the OOM killed the jenkins process. There is some evidence for this in the syslog:

```
kern.log.1:May 25 00:47:21 ip-10-191-49-253 kernel: [1925974.611793] dockerd invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x24201ca, order=0, oom_score_adj=-500
kern.log.1:May 25 01:17:15 ip-10-191-49-253 kernel: [1927768.824142] abi-compliance- invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x24201ca, order=0, oom_score_adj=0
kern.log.1:May 25 07:32:03 ip-10-191-49-253 kernel: [1950256.653939] java invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x24201ca, order=0, oom_score_adj=0
```

I’ve been waiting drogon to finish other abicheckers to be sure that the problem is not related to jenkins behaviour \(timeouts or empty console\) and it was able to finish [gazebo successfully](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/822/consoleFull).

We have different options to workaround about this problem:

1. Remove drogon from large-memory
2. Add another huge-memory label to be used for ignition-pyhsics abichecker and add it to r2d2 and optimus.
content.html:
yay! nice work! Not fully sure about what can happen with drogon but my main hypothesis is that memory consumption reach top and the OOM killed the jenkins process. There is some evidence for this in the syslog:

kern.log.1:May 25 00:47:21 ip-10-191-49-253 kernel: [1925974.611793] dockerd invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x24201ca, order=0, oom_score_adj=-500
kern.log.1:May 25 01:17:15 ip-10-191-49-253 kernel: [1927768.824142] abi-compliance- invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x24201ca, order=0, oom_score_adj=0
kern.log.1:May 25 07:32:03 ip-10-191-49-253 kernel: [1950256.653939] java invoked oom-killer: gfp_mask=0x24201ca, order=0, oom_score_adj=0

I’ve been waiting drogon to finish other abicheckers to be sure that the problem is not related to jenkins behaviour (timeouts or empty console) and it was able to finish gazebo successfully.

We have different options to workaround about this problem:

  1. Remove drogon from large-memory
  2. Add another huge-memory label to be used for ignition-pyhsics abichecker and add it to r2d2 and optimus.

pull_request.title: Fix and speed up ign-physics ABI builds

update.description:
I fixed some ABI builds in pull request #834, but ign-physics was still broken. I've made two changes to fix the build and one change to speed it up.

* 1st fix: use c++17 if USE_GCC8 is true. The physics jobs were failing with error logs complaining about c++17 types (see https://gist.github.com/scpeters/5c3dd97591a3f06ab127a2efb9a2ff1a)
* 2nd fix: retry abi checker script with `-quick` if it doesn't generate a report. It seems to run out of memory in the normal mode, but setting `-quick` causes it to "[disable check of some template instances](https://github.com/lvc/abi-compliance-checker/blob/master/abi-compliance-checker.pl#L708-L709)", which appears to be enough to fix the ign-physics build.
* speed thing up by not building the tests

it passed with r2d2: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=83)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/83/

but drogon seems to always get disconnected when running this job: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=82)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_physics-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/82/
